results.definition: the most direct or specific meaning of a word or expression; the class of objects that an expression refers to
examples: the extension of `satellite of Mars' is the set containing only Demos and Phobos

results.definition: an addition that extends a main building
amount or degree or range to which something extends
examples: the wire has an extension of 50 feet

results.definition: an addition to the length of something
the spreading of something (a belief or practice) into new regions
an additional telephone set that is connected to the same telephone line
an educational opportunity provided by colleges and universities to people who are not enrolled as regular students
a string of characters beginning with a period and followed by one or more letters; the optional second part of a PC computer filename
examples: most applications provide extensions for the files they create
most BASIC files use the filename extension .BAS

results.definition: act of expanding in scope; making more widely available
examples: extension of the program to all in need

results.definition: act of stretching or straightening out a flexed limb
a mutually agreed delay in the date set for the completion of a job or payment of a debt
examples: they applied for an extension of the loan

results.definition: the ability to raise the working leg high in the air
examples: the dancer was praised for her uncanny extension
good extension comes from a combination of training and native ability
